wiki_catalogs.name: Project Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the LANrage project overview section focused on the gaming VPN solution. Explain the project's purpose as a zero-config mesh VPN that enables LAN-like gaming experiences over the internet, addressing NAT traversal challenges without port forwarding. Document the core philosophy of putting gamers first, emphasizing latency obsession and zero-configuration setup. Include the project's architecture overview showing direct P2P connections, smart relay fallback, and broadcast emulation for legacy games. Provide comparison with existing solutions like Hamachi, ZeroTier, and Tailscale, highlighting gaming-specific advantages. Document the supported platforms, system requirements, and key differentiators. Include practical examples of common gaming scenarios and use cases. Use terminology consistent with the codebase and gaming VPN domain.

wiki_catalogs.name: Introduction and Philosophy
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the LANrage introduction and philosophy section focused on the gaming VPN solution's core mission and values. Explain the project's fundamental philosophy of putting gamers first, emphasizing latency obsession and zero-configuration setup principles. Document the problem statement addressing NAT traversal challenges and the limitations of traditional gaming VPN solutions. Describe the project's commitment to simplicity, performance, and gaming-specific optimizations. Include the vision for seamless LAN-like gaming experiences over the internet without technical barriers. Provide context on why existing solutions fell short and how LANrage addresses these gaps. Use terminology consistent with the codebase and gaming community.

wiki_catalogs.name: System Overview
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's system overview focusing on the mesh VPN architecture and core design philosophy. Explain the fundamental problem of gaming networking over the internet and how LANrage solves it through zero-configuration mesh networking. Document the three-tier architecture including control plane, data plane, and client application layers. Describe the system's approach to NAT traversal, peer discovery, and automatic connection establishment. Include the virtual network topology, subnet allocation, and interface management. Explain the security model based on peer-to-peer encryption and trustless relay nodes. Provide high-level component interaction diagrams showing data flow from client initialization through party creation to active gaming sessions. Address the performance targets and scalability considerations that drive the architectural decisions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Network Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's network management system focused on WireGuard interface creation, cross-platform implementation, and platform-specific handling. Document the NetworkManager class architecture including WireGuard key generation, interface creation on Windows and Linux platforms, and peer management operations. Explain the asynchronous command execution system, error handling strategies, and logging mechanisms. Detail the platform-specific implementations for Windows tunnel service management and Linux kernel interface creation. Include configuration file generation, key persistence, and cleanup procedures. Document the peer addition/removal operations, latency measurement capabilities, and interface status monitoring. Provide implementation details for the _run_command method with timeout handling, the _ensure_keys method for key generation, and the cross-platform interface creation strategies. Address common issues like missing WireGuard installations, permission requirements, and platform-specific error scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Party Management API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for LANrage's party management endpoints. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for creating, joining, leaving parties, and retrieving party status. Include detailed examples for CreatePartyRequest and JoinPartyRequest models with validation rules. Document error handling, status codes, and common use cases. Provide practical examples for party lifecycle management and integration patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Discord Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for LANrage's Discord integration system focused on webhook notifications, Rich Presence, and bot functionality. Document the DiscordIntegration class architecture including webhook configuration, notification batching system, and real-time presence updates. Explain the webhook setup process including URL validation, embed formatting, and batch processing mechanisms. Detail the Discord Rich Presence integration covering app ID configuration, asset requirements, and presence state management. Document the Discord bot implementation including token configuration, channel management, and message delivery. Include setup guides for Discord app creation, webhook permissions, and bot configuration. Provide troubleshooting guides for common integration issues, API rate limits, and connection failures. Address security considerations for webhook URLs and bot tokens.

wiki_catalogs.name: Game Detection Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the game detection mechanism focusing on the multi-method detection system. Document the three-tier detection approach: process name matching (95% confidence), window title detection (80% confidence for Windows), and port-based detection (60% confidence). Explain the fuzzy matching algorithm using Levenshtein distance for process name comparison, including threshold calculations and similarity scoring. Detail the detection loop architecture, confidence scoring system, and how results are ranked and selected. Include platform-specific considerations for Windows-only features like window title detection. Provide examples of detection scenarios, confidence thresholds, and troubleshooting common detection failures. Document the detection history tracking and event logging system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Peer Discovery System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the peer discovery system component. Explain the distributed peer discovery mechanism using local file-based announcements and broadcast protocols. Document the LocalControlPlane implementation with discovery.json file sharing for same-LAN scenarios. Detail the peer registration process including PeerInfo data structures with peer_id, public_key, NAT type detection, and IP/port information. Cover the peer announcement system that writes party information to shared discovery files. Include peer validation mechanisms, NAT type enumeration, and peer lifecycle management. Address the fallback strategies when remote control servers are unavailable. Provide examples of peer discovery workflows and troubleshooting common discovery issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: WireGuard Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's WireGuard VPN implementation covering the NetworkManager class architecture and cross-platform interface management. Document the key generation process using X25519 elliptic curve cryptography, base64 encoding for configuration, and secure key storage with proper file permissions. Explain the platform-specific implementations for Windows (WireGuardTunnel service) and Linux (ip link type wireguard) including configuration file management, interface creation, and cleanup procedures. Detail the virtual network configuration with subnet 10.66.0.0/16, interface name lanrage0, and MTU optimization to 1420 bytes. Document the WireGuard commands used for peer management, persistent keepalive configuration, and interface status monitoring. Include error handling strategies, timeout management, and logging mechanisms for network operations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Metrics
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for LANrage's performance metrics system focused on real-time network monitoring and quality assessment. Document the MetricsCollector class and its role in collecting system-level metrics including CPU usage, memory consumption, and network throughput. Explain peer-specific metrics tracking for latency, bandwidth utilization, packet loss, and connection quality scores. Detail the data structures including MetricPoint, PeerMetrics, and SystemMetrics classes with their properties and relationships. Document the connection quality prediction algorithm that calculates weighted scores based on latency, packet loss, and jitter. Include examples of metrics collection intervals, data aggregation functions, and historical data retrieval. Explain the peer status tracking system and quality trend analysis. Provide guidance on interpreting metrics data, setting up monitoring dashboards, and using metrics for performance optimization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Startup Sequence
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for LANrage's application startup sequence and initialization workflow. Document the step-by-step initialization process from main entry point through settings database setup, configuration loading, and network initialization. Explain the dependency resolution order and error handling strategies during startup. Detail the signal handler registration for graceful shutdown and the async task orchestration pattern. Include the database integrity validation, settings initialization, and fallback mechanisms for first-time users. Document the startup validation checks for WireGuard installation, administrative privileges, and interface conflicts. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common startup failures and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Peer Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the peer management subsystem within LANrage's control plane. Document the PeerInfo data structure including peer identification, network information (public/private IPs, ports), NAT type classification, and last seen timestamps. Explain peer registration, authentication, and lifecycle management including automatic cleanup of stale peers. Detail the peer discovery mechanism, peer-to-peer communication patterns, and trust model implementation. Cover the peer validation system including NAT type verification and network topology detection. Include practical examples of peer registration flows, peer updates, and peer removal scenarios. Document the peer state persistence mechanism and synchronization patterns across multiple clients.

wiki_catalogs.name: Party Lifecycle Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for party lifecycle management covering party creation, joining, leaving, and dissolution processes. Document the PartyManager.create_party() method including party ID generation, initial peer registration, and control plane registration. Explain the join_party() workflow with peer validation, NAT type propagation, and automatic peer connection establishment. Detail the leave_party() process including graceful disconnection, control plane cleanup, and resource deallocation. Cover party state persistence, session timeout handling, and automatic cleanup procedures. Include error handling for network failures, control plane unavailability, and peer disconnections. Provide practical examples of party management operations and troubleshooting common lifecycle issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database Schema & Storage
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's database schema and storage system focused on the settings database architecture. Document the database-first configuration approach including table structures, field definitions, and data types used for storing configuration settings. Explain the schema evolution process, migration strategies, and backward compatibility maintenance. Detail the settings persistence mechanism including CRUD operations, transaction handling, and data integrity constraints. Document the relationship between configuration models and database tables, including field mapping and serialization/deserialization processes. Include database initialization procedures, schema validation, and error handling for corrupted or missing databases. Address database performance considerations, indexing strategies, and query optimization for configuration retrieval. Provide examples of database queries and schema modifications for different deployment scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: WireGuard Interface Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for WireGuard interface management focused on the NetworkManager class implementation. Document the interface creation process including the initialize() method workflow, WireGuard key generation using X25519 elliptic curve cryptography, and base64 encoding for configuration. Explain the asynchronous command execution system through _run_command() with timeout handling, error propagation, and logging mechanisms. Detail the interface status monitoring via wg show commands, latency measurement capabilities using ping utilities, and peer management operations including add_peer() and remove_peer() methods. Include configuration file generation for different platforms, key persistence strategies, and cleanup procedures. Address common issues like missing WireGuard installations, permission requirements, and command execution failures with their respective troubleshooting steps.

wiki_catalogs.name: STUN Server Detection
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for STUN server detection and NAT type classification. Document the STUN protocol implementation including message construction, attribute parsing, and response validation. Explain the NAT type classification algorithm covering OPEN, FULL_CONE, RESTRICTED_CONE, PORT_RESTRICTED_CONE, and SYMMETRIC NAT detection. Detail the STUN server selection mechanism with multiple fallback servers, timeout handling, and error recovery strategies. Include the STUN message format specification, transaction ID management, and magic cookie verification. Document the simplified NAT detection logic and its limitations. Provide examples of STUN request/response handling, attribute parsing for MAPPED-ADDRESS and XOR-MAPPED-ADDRESS, and the correlation between local and public IP/port mapping. Address common STUN server failures and alternative detection methods.

wiki_catalogs.name: Webhook Notifications
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for Discord webhook notifications system focused on webhook configuration, notification batching, and message formatting. Document the DiscordWebhookHelper class including webhook URL validation, setup instructions, and URL format requirements. Explain the NotificationBatcher class architecture covering batch interval configuration, pending notification management, and flush mechanisms. Detail the webhook notification methods including notify_party_created, notify_peer_joined, notify_peer_left, notify_game_started, and notify_game_ended with their respective message formats and embed configurations. Include webhook URL validation logic, embed styling options, and error handling strategies. Provide step-by-step setup instructions for creating Discord webhooks, configuring webhook permissions, and integrating with LANrage settings. Address webhook rate limits, API response handling, and troubleshooting common webhook issues including invalid URLs and permission errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Windows Tunnel Service Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Windows-specific WireGuard tunnel service management covering the complete lifecycle of Windows tunnel services. Document the _create_interface_windows() method including config file generation with proper .conf file formatting containing PrivateKey, Address, and ListenPort parameters. Explain the service naming convention WireGuardTunnel$interface_name, service existence checking via sc query command, and installation procedures using wireguard /installtunnelservice. Detail the config file structure with base64-encoded private key, IP address assignment (10.66.0.1/16), and default ListenPort (51820). Cover error handling strategies for service conflicts, installation timeouts, and permission issues. Include troubleshooting steps for common Windows issues like service dependency problems, firewall conflicts, and installation failures. Document the cleanup process via /uninstalltunnelservice and service query operations for status verification.

wiki_catalogs.name: Game Detection Algorithms
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the game detection algorithms section. Document the three-tier detection system including process name matching with fuzzy logic, window title detection for Windows platforms, and port-based detection. Explain the Levenshtein distance algorithm implementation for fuzzy executable matching, confidence scoring mechanisms (95% for process, 80% for window title, 60% for ports), and the detection ranking system. Detail the async detection loop architecture, process enumeration using psutil, and platform-specific implementations. Include the detection history tracking, confidence threshold calculations, and error handling strategies. Provide concrete examples of detection scenarios, performance considerations for each detection method, and troubleshooting common detection failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Webhook Notifications
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Discord webhook notifications focused on automated party status updates, game session alerts, and real-time gaming events. Document the webhook configuration process including URL validation, channel setup, and payload formatting. Explain the notification batching system that groups multiple events within 500ms windows to reduce API calls. Detail the notification types including party creation, peer joining/left events, game start/end notifications, and custom messages. Document the webhook payload structure with embed formatting, color coding, timestamps, and footer information. Include practical examples of webhook setup, message templates, and error handling strategies. Address webhook URL validation, rate limiting considerations, and troubleshooting common webhook failures. Provide implementation details for the NotificationBatcher class, queue management, and asynchronous notification delivery.

wiki_catalogs.name: Getting Started
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive getting started content for LANrage focused on rapid onboarding and first-time setup. Document the complete installation process including system requirements, dependency installation, and initial configuration. Provide step-by-step instructions for Windows and Linux/Mac environments. Include the 90-second quick start guide with immediate setup verification. Document the web UI interface access and basic navigation. Explain the party creation workflow from initial setup through first gaming session. Include troubleshooting for common installation issues and environment setup problems. Provide verification steps to ensure proper installation. Address prerequisite knowledge requirements and system prerequisites. Include screenshots and command-line examples for clarity.

wiki_catalogs.name: Key Features and Benefits
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the LANrage key features and benefits section focused on the gaming VPN's core capabilities and user advantages. Document the zero-config mesh VPN functionality, direct P2P connections with relay fallback, NAT traversal solutions, and broadcast emulation for legacy games. Explain the gaming-specific optimizations, automatic game detection, and profile-based configurations. Highlight the web-based configuration interface, real-time metrics, and Discord integration features. Compare with existing solutions like Hamachi, ZeroTier, and Tailscale, showcasing LANrage's unique advantages. Include practical examples of gaming scenarios where these features provide tangible benefits. Use clear, user-friendly language while maintaining technical accuracy.

wiki_catalogs.name: Networking Architecture
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for LANrage's networking architecture covering the data plane implementation using WireGuard VPN technology. Document the mesh networking design enabling direct P2P connections with intelligent relay fallback mechanisms. Explain the connection priority system from direct P2P to TCP tunnel fallback, including latency overhead calculations and performance characteristics. Detail the virtual network configuration including subnet allocation (10.66.0.0/16), interface management (lanrage0), and MTU optimization (1420 bytes). Document the NAT traversal strategies including STUN server detection, UDP hole punching, and TURN relay coordination. Explain the security implementation using WireGuard encryption (ChaCha20-Poly1305), X25519 key exchange, and peer-to-peer trust model. Include platform-specific networking considerations and cross-platform compatibility approaches.

wiki_catalogs.name: Party Coordination
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's party coordination system focused on mesh networking orchestration, peer discovery, and session persistence. Document the PartyManager class architecture including party creation, member management, and connection coordination. Explain the mesh networking topology implementation, peer-to-peer connection establishment, and session state management. Detail the party lifecycle from creation through dissolution, including member joining, leaving, and automatic cleanup procedures. Document the integration with the control plane for peer discovery and the NAT traversal coordination for establishing direct connections. Include the database persistence layer for party state, configuration management, and metrics collection. Provide implementation details for party synchronization, conflict resolution, and graceful degradation strategies. Address common scenarios like party leader changes, network partitioning, and peer connectivity issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Metrics API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for LANrage's metrics and monitoring endpoints. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, query parameters, and response schemas for peer metrics, system metrics, latency history, and game sessions. Include detailed examples for metrics retrieval with duration parameters and filtering options. Document the metrics data structures, aggregation methods, and historical data formats. Provide practical examples for monitoring integration and performance analysis.

wiki_catalogs.name: Game Server Browser
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for LANrage's game server browser system focused on server discovery, registration, and management. Document the server browser architecture including server registration mechanisms, player count tracking, and filtering capabilities. Explain the server discovery process including UDP broadcasting, server heartbeat mechanisms, and dynamic server listing. Detail the server registration workflow covering server metadata submission, validation processes, and lifecycle management. Document the web interface components including server listings, filtering options, and connection prompts. Include server configuration requirements, port specifications, and network considerations. Provide setup guides for hosting public servers, configuring server metadata, and managing server availability. Address server browser performance optimization, caching strategies, and scalability considerations. Include troubleshooting guides for server discovery issues and connection problems.

wiki_catalogs.name: Game Profile System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the game profile system covering the GameProfile data structure and JSON-based configuration management. Document all profile fields including name, executable, ports, protocol selection (UDP/TCP/both), broadcast and multicast support, keepalive intervals, MTU settings, and optimization parameters. Explain the profile loading mechanism from JSON files organized by genre categories, including support for custom profiles in the custom directory. Detail the adaptive keepalive calculation based on NAT type detection and how profiles override default settings. Include examples of profile configurations for different game types, parameter explanations, and optimization strategies. Document the profile cache system with TTL expiration and dynamic loading. Address profile validation, error handling, and troubleshooting invalid profile configurations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Key Exchange Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the key exchange mechanism used in LANrage's control plane. Explain the cryptographic handshake process for establishing secure peer-to-peer connections. Document the PeerInfo data structure including public_key field and its role in the key exchange. Detail the NAT type detection system and how it affects key exchange strategies. Cover the signal_connection method for WebRTC-style signaling and NAT traversal coordination. Include the security considerations for key distribution and peer authentication. Address the integration with WireGuard key management and how cryptographic keys are managed throughout the peer lifecycle. Provide examples of key exchange workflows and security best practices.

wiki_catalogs.name: NAT Traversal Strategies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for LANrage's NAT traversal strategies covering the multi-layered approach to establishing direct P2P connections. Document the STUN server detection mechanism for NAT type identification and public IP discovery. Explain the UDP hole punching technique including simultaneous open technique and connection establishment timing. Detail the fallback mechanisms from direct P2P to TCP tunnel through relay servers when NAT traversal fails. Include the connection priority system with latency-based decision making, timeout handling, and graceful degradation to relay-only operation. Document the NAT type classification (Full Cone, Restricted Cone, Port Restricted Cone, Symmetric) and corresponding traversal strategies. Explain the role of keepalive mechanisms, connection health monitoring, and automatic failover detection.

wiki_catalogs.name: Performance Profiling
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed documentation for LANrage's performance profiling and optimization tools focused on identifying bottlenecks and measuring system performance. Document the profiler module's functionality for tracking execution times, memory usage, and resource consumption across different components. Explain the performance monitor utility for continuous system health checking and performance regression detection. Detail profiling methodologies including timing decorators, bottleneck identification techniques, and optimization strategies. Include examples of profiling different aspects of the application such as network operations, game detection, and party management. Document performance benchmarking procedures, comparison metrics, and optimization recommendations. Provide guidance on interpreting profiling results, identifying performance hotspots, and implementing performance improvements. Address profiling best practices, tool integration, and automated performance monitoring workflows.

wiki_catalogs.name: Runtime Orchestration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for LANrage's runtime component orchestration and coordination patterns. Document the PartyManager-NetworkManager-Config dependency injection and initialization sequence. Explain the async task management for API server, metrics collection, and background operations. Detail the event-driven architecture using asyncio for concurrent operations and WebSocket connections for real-time updates. Document the graceful shutdown procedure including task cancellation, peer disconnection, and resource cleanup. Include the component lifecycle management, error propagation patterns, and fault tolerance mechanisms. Address the integration between API endpoints and business logic components during active gaming sessions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Party Coordination
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for LANrage's party coordination system. Detail the PartyInfo data structure including party metadata, host identification, creation timestamps, and peer collections. Explain party lifecycle management from creation to dissolution, including automatic cleanup of empty parties. Document party membership management including peer joining, leaving, and role assignments. Cover the party discovery mechanism and how parties are announced and discovered across the network. Detail the party state synchronization patterns and conflict resolution strategies. Include practical examples of party creation workflows, member coordination, and party termination procedures. Address party security considerations including authentication tokens and access control mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Mesh Networking Orchestration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for mesh networking orchestration focusing on peer-to-peer connection establishment and management. Document the NAT compatibility matrix and direct connection strategies for different NAT types. Explain the ConnectionCoordinator role in managing simultaneous peer connections and connection prioritization. Detail the peer discovery process through the control plane and automatic connection establishment algorithms. Cover connection quality monitoring, latency measurement integration, and adaptive connection switching. Document the fallback mechanisms to relay connections when direct P2P fails. Include connection state management, reconnection strategies, and network topology optimization. Provide examples of connection establishment scenarios and troubleshooting connection issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Settings Management & Validation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for LANrage's settings management and validation system focused on runtime configuration handling and validation rules. Document the settings validation framework including type checking, range validation, and format verification for each configuration parameter. Explain the default value system, setting precedence rules, and validation error handling mechanisms. Detail the settings update process including validation pipelines, change tracking, and consistency enforcement. Document the integration with Pydantic models for type safety and validation, including custom validators and field serialization. Include examples of validation scenarios, error messages, and troubleshooting invalid configurations. Address settings hot-reloading capabilities, runtime updates, and the impact on active connections. Provide guidance on extending validation rules and adding new configuration parameters.

wiki_catalogs.name: Cross-Platform Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for cross-platform implementation details focusing on platform-specific WireGuard interface creation strategies. Document the Windows implementation using WireGuard Tunnel service management, including config file generation (.conf files), service installation via wireguard /installtunnelservice, and service query operations. Explain the Linux implementation using kernel-level interface creation through ip link commands, wg set operations, and sudo privilege requirements. Detail the platform detection logic, conditional execution paths, and error handling strategies specific to each operating system. Include security considerations like file permissions on Unix systems, service management on Windows, and root access requirements on Linux. Address platform-specific troubleshooting scenarios, permission issues, and service dependency problems with their resolution strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: UDP Hole Punching
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for UDP hole punching implementation and direct P2P connection establishment. Document the hole punching algorithm including packet transmission timing, message formats, and response handling. Explain the LANRAGE_PUNCH and LANRAGE_PUNCH_ACK message protocol, timing strategies for optimal hole creation, and the role of WireGuard port binding. Detail the socket configuration, timeout management, and error handling during the punching process. Include the packet sending sequence, inter-packet delays, and receiver-side acknowledgment processing. Document the conditions under which hole punching succeeds or fails, including NAT type compatibility requirements. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common hole punching failures such as firewall restrictions, asymmetric routing, and timing issues. Address the relationship between hole punching and different NAT traversal strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rich Presence
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for Discord Rich Presence integration focused on presence state management, asset configuration, and real-time updates. Document the Rich Presence connection process including Discord app ID configuration, pypresence library requirements, and connection error handling. Explain the update_presence method parameters including state descriptions, details text, party size tuples, and start timestamps. Detail the presence asset requirements covering large image configuration, asset naming conventions, and upload procedures through Discord Developer Portal. Include presence state management covering different gaming scenarios, party status updates, and presence clearing mechanisms. Provide setup instructions for creating Discord applications, uploading presence assets, and configuring app IDs. Address common Rich Presence issues including missing assets, connection failures, and presence update errors. Document the threading model for RPC operations and executor-based updates to prevent blocking the event loop.

wiki_catalogs.name: Linux Kernel Interface Creation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Linux-specific WireGuard kernel interface creation covering the complete interface lifecycle from creation to cleanup. Document the _create_interface_linux() method including root/sudo privilege verification via _check_root(), interface creation using ip link add dev interface_name type wireguard, and wg set operations for private key assignment. Explain the IP address assignment (10.66.0.1/16), MTU configuration (1420) for WireGuard overhead, and interface activation via ip link set up. Detail the sudo privilege requirements, error handling for permission failures, and comprehensive cleanup procedures via _cleanup_interface_linux() including ip link delete operations. Include troubleshooting steps for common Linux issues like missing sudo privileges, kernel module availability, interface conflicts, and wg command failures. Document the secure key file permissions (chmod 0o600) and file system integration patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Game Profile System
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the game profile system covering the GameProfile data structure, profile loading mechanisms, and configuration management. Document the GameProfile class fields including name, executable, ports, protocol, broadcast/multicast flags, keepalive intervals, MTU settings, and optimization parameters. Explain the profile loading from JSON files organized by genre, custom profile creation and persistence, and the ProfileCache mechanism with TTL expiration. Provide examples of profile JSON structure, custom profile creation guidelines, and troubleshooting profile loading issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Rich Presence Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Discord Rich Presence integration focused on game state display, party status updates, and player activity tracking. Address the optional nature of Rich Presence, dependency requirements (pypresence), and graceful degradation when not available. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common RPC connection issues, asset validation problems, and permission errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the session management system covering party lifecycle and state persistence. Document the PartyInfo data structure with party_id, name, host_id, and peer collections. Explain the party registration process including host peer initialization and participant management. Detail the state persistence system using StatePersister with write-behind caching and batched disk I/O operations. Cover the cleanup task for removing stale peers and empty parties after inactivity timeouts. Document the session state synchronization between local and remote control planes. Include party disbandment logic, peer removal procedures, and graceful session termination. Address the database-first configuration integration and how session data is stored and retrieved. Provide examples of session management workflows and state recovery procedures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Mesh Networking Design
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for LANrage's mesh networking architecture enabling scalable peer-to-peer connectivity without central coordination. Document the fully connected mesh topology where each peer maintains direct connections to all other peers in the party. Explain the connection matrix management, peer discovery mechanisms, and automatic connection establishment procedures. Detail the bandwidth aggregation benefits of mesh networking, including throughput scaling with additional peers and redundancy advantages. Document the connection state management, peer health monitoring, and automatic reconnection handling. Include the routing implications within the virtual LAN environment, traffic distribution strategies, and load balancing across multiple peer connections. Explain the scalability considerations, connection limits, and performance characteristics of large mesh networks.

wiki_catalogs.name: Dashboard & Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for LANrage's monitoring dashboard and real-time visualization system focused on network status display and performance monitoring. Document the web-based dashboard interface showing peer connectivity status, connection quality indicators, and system resource usage. Explain the API endpoints providing real-time metrics data to the dashboard including peer summaries, system metrics, and game session information. Detail the dashboard components including latency charts, bandwidth monitors, peer status indicators, and quality score displays. Document the WebSocket connections for real-time updates and the polling mechanisms for periodic data refresh. Include examples of dashboard customization, alert configurations, and notification systems. Explain the integration between backend metrics collection and frontend visualization. Provide guidance on dashboard maintenance, performance optimization, and extending monitoring capabilities with custom widgets and alerts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Data Flow Patterns
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's data flow patterns and information exchange between components. Document the request-response patterns between API server and business logic components. Explain the real-time data propagation through WebSocket connections for metrics, party status, and connection updates. Detail the event-driven communication patterns using asyncio queues and callbacks. Document the data transformation pipelines from raw network measurements to API responses. Include the caching strategies, data validation flows, and consistency guarantees across distributed components. Address the asynchronous data processing patterns and backpressure handling mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Database & State Persistence
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for LANrage's state persistence and database management system. Document the StatePersister class including write-behind caching, batched writes, and atomic file operations. Explain the SQLite-based control plane implementation and file-based state storage using JSON serialization. Detail the state synchronization patterns, write optimization strategies, and error handling for disk operations. Cover the state loading and saving mechanisms including graceful degradation when persistence fails. Document the database schema design for parties, peers, and control plane state. Include practical examples of state persistence workflows, recovery procedures, and performance optimization techniques. Address data integrity guarantees, backup strategies, and migration procedures for state format changes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Peer Management & Coordination
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for peer management and coordination systems within parties. Document the Peer data model including peer identification, WireGuard key management, and virtual IP allocation. Explain peer state tracking, connection type classification (direct, relayed, connecting, failed), and NAT type compatibility assessment. Detail the peer discovery and synchronization process through the control plane. Cover peer removal procedures, automatic cleanup of disconnected peers, and peer count limitations. Document peer ranking algorithms, connection priority assignment, and load balancing considerations. Include peer health monitoring, latency tracking, and performance-based connection optimization. Provide examples of peer management operations and handling peer-related network issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Configuration Lifecycle & Migration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's configuration lifecycle management focused on configuration loading, initialization, updates, and migration processes. Document the configuration loading sequence including database initialization checks, fallback mechanisms, and error recovery procedures. Explain the configuration migration system including version detection, automatic upgrades, and rollback capabilities. Detail the configuration backup and restore procedures including export/import functionality and data preservation strategies. Document the configuration validation pipeline during loading, including syntax checking, dependency validation, and conflict resolution. Include the configuration hot-reload mechanism, runtime modification handling, and the impact on active services. Address configuration security measures including encryption, access controls, and audit logging. Provide examples of common configuration scenarios, migration scripts, and troubleshooting procedures for configuration issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Key Generation and Security
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for WireGuard key generation and security implementation focused on cryptographic operations and key management. Document the X25519 elliptic curve key generation using the cryptography library, private key generation through X25519PrivateKey.generate(), and public key derivation. Explain the key serialization process including Raw encoding, NoEncryption for private keys, and PublicFormat for public keys. Detail the base64 encoding conversion for WireGuard configuration compatibility, key persistence mechanisms in the keys directory, and file permission management on Unix systems (chmod 0600). Include security considerations like key storage protection, entropy sources, and cryptographic best practices. Address key rotation strategies, backup procedures, and recovery mechanisms for key loss scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Connection Coordination
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the ConnectionCoordinator class and peer connection orchestration system. Document the connection strategy determination logic including direct vs relay decision making based on NAT types. Explain the peer coordination workflow from initial connection attempt through fallback mechanisms. Detail the relay discovery process including control plane integration, latency measurement, and best relay selection. Document the endpoint negotiation process, strategy validation, and connection result reporting. Include the integration with control plane for relay server discovery, the fallback hierarchy from control plane to configured relays to default servers. Explain the latency measurement techniques using ICMP ping, error handling for network failures, and performance optimization strategies. Address the coordination between multiple peers, connection state management, and graceful degradation when optimal connections cannot be established.

wiki_catalogs.name: Discord Bot
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed documentation for Discord bot functionality focused on bot configuration, message delivery, and channel management. Document the bot connection process including token validation, intent configuration, and connection error handling. Explain the bot message sending mechanism through send_bot_message method including channel ID configuration, message formatting, and delivery confirmation. Detail the bot event handling covering on_ready and on_disconnect events with their respective actions and logging. Include bot setup instructions for creating Discord applications, generating bot tokens, and configuring channel permissions. Document the minimal intent configuration focusing on guild access and message sending capabilities. Address bot connectivity issues including invalid tokens, insufficient permissions, and channel access problems. Explain the asynchronous bot execution model and background task management for continuous operation. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common bot-related issues including connection timeouts, message delivery failures, and permission errors.

wiki_catalogs.name: Cross-Platform Detection Logic
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for cross-platform detection and conditional execution logic used throughout the NetworkManager class. Document the platform detection mechanism using platform.system() comparisons for Windows and Linux, the conditional execution paths in _create_interface() method, and the platform-specific method dispatch. Explain the _check_wireguard() method differences between Windows wireguard.exe command detection and Linux wg command verification. Detail the error handling strategies for unsupported platforms, platform-specific exception raising with descriptive error messages, and logging patterns for platform detection failures. Include the timing_decorator usage for performance monitoring across platforms and the unified interface creation workflow that abstracts platform differences. Document the fallback mechanisms and graceful degradation strategies for platform detection failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Broadcast Emulation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the broadcast emulation system designed for legacy games requiring multicast/broadcast support. Document the GameOptimizer's broadcast monitoring capabilities, dynamic port monitoring for broadcast traffic, and the custom broadcast ports whitelist system. Explain the broadcast port detection mechanisms, packet interception and forwarding, and the integration with the party system for game-specific optimizations. Detail the custom broadcast port configuration through JSON files, runtime port management, and the relationship between broadcast emulation and game profiles. Include the technical implementation of broadcast packet handling, performance implications, and troubleshooting broadcast connectivity issues. Provide examples of configuring broadcast emulation for specific games and monitoring broadcast traffic.

wiki_catalogs.name: Discord Bot Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Discord bot integration focused on automated messaging, party management commands, and online presence functionality. Document the bot setup process including token configuration, channel permissions, and intent requirements. Explain the minimal intent configuration excluding message content while maintaining guild and message sending capabilities. Detail the bot lifecycle including connection management, reconnection handling, and graceful shutdown procedures. Document the message sending functionality including direct channel messages, error handling, and rate limiting considerations. Include practical examples of bot configuration, message formatting, and integration with party management systems. Address the optional nature of bot functionality, dependency requirements (discord.py), and fallback mechanisms when bot is unavailable. Provide troubleshooting guidance for common bot connection issues, permission errors, and message delivery failures.

wiki_catalogs.name: Core Components
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's core components focused on the fundamental building blocks of the gaming VPN system. Document the network management system including WireGuard interface creation, cross-platform implementation, and platform-specific handling. Explain the party management system coordinating mesh networking, peer discovery, and session persistence. Detail the configuration management system using database-first approach replacing traditional config files. Document the NAT traversal system implementing STUN/TURN hole punching and relay fallback strategies. Explain the game detection and optimization system with automatic game profiling and broadcast emulation. Include the Discord integration system for webhooks and Rich Presence. Provide implementation details, configuration options, public interfaces, and usage patterns for each component. Address component interactions, initialization sequences, and error handling strategies.

wiki_catalogs.name: Installation and Setup Guide
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the LANrage installation and setup guide section focused on getting users up and running quickly. Document step-by-step installation procedures for different platforms, including command-line installation, batch script usage, and manual setup processes. Explain initial configuration steps, environment setup, and first-time user onboarding. Include troubleshooting common installation issues, dependency resolution, and platform-specific setup requirements. Document the web-based configuration interface access and basic setup walkthrough. Provide verification steps to ensure proper installation and connectivity. Include backup and recovery procedures for configuration files. Address security considerations during initial setup and network configuration best practices.

wiki_catalogs.name: Component Interactions
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for LANrage's component interaction patterns and data flow architecture. Document the startup sequence from main entry point through configuration loading to network initialization. Explain the orchestration patterns between PartyManager, NetworkManager, and Config components during runtime. Detail the API server integration with business logic components and real-time update propagation. Document the event-driven architecture using async/await patterns for concurrent operations and WebSocket connections for real-time updates. Explain the dependency injection patterns and component lifecycle management. Include sequence diagrams showing typical workflows from party creation through active gaming sessions. Address error handling strategies, graceful degradation, and component isolation patterns. Document the plugin architecture and extension points for future enhancements.

wiki_catalogs.name: NAT Traversal
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's NAT traversal system focused on STUN/TURN hole punching, connection strategies, and relay fallback mechanisms. Document the NAT traversal algorithms including symmetric NAT detection, UDP hole punching techniques, and connection coordinator functionality. Explain the multi-strategy approach for different NAT types, the STUN server selection and testing procedures, and the TURN relay fallback system. Detail the connection establishment process, timing strategies, and failure recovery mechanisms. Document the integration with the party management system for coordinated connection attempts and the metrics collection for connection quality assessment. Include the implementation of the connection coordinator, peer connectivity testing, and adaptive strategy selection based on network conditions. Provide technical details for the NAT classification algorithms, the hole punching sequence, and the relay negotiation process. Address common NAT traversal challenges and their solutions.

wiki_catalogs.name: Server Browser API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for LANrage's game server browser endpoints. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, query parameters, and request/response schemas for server listing, registration, heartbeat, player count updates, and server details. Include detailed examples for RegisterServerRequest and UpdatePlayerCountRequest models with validation rules. Document server filtering options, favorite management, and latency measurement. Provide practical examples for server registration workflows and integration patterns.

wiki_catalogs.name: Custom Game Profiles
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create detailed content for custom game profile creation and management system. Document the process of creating custom profiles for unsupported games, including the JSON configuration format and required fields. Explain the custom profile loading mechanism from the game_profiles.json file in the configuration directory, including profile merging with built-in profiles. Detail the profile validation process, error handling for malformed JSON, and troubleshooting common configuration issues. Include step-by-step examples of creating profiles for custom games, modded games, or games not yet in the official catalog. Document the profile persistence system, file location requirements, and backup procedures. Address advanced customization options, performance tuning parameters, and integration with the detection system. Provide templates and best practices for optimal profile configuration.

wiki_catalogs.name: Remote Control Server
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for the remote control server implementation and client connectivity. Document the RemoteControlPlane class with WebSocket-based communication to centralized control servers. Explain the connection establishment process including URL conversion from HTTP(S) to WebSocket, authentication mechanisms, and reconnection strategies. Detail the message handling system for party updates, peer notifications, and signaling messages. Cover the fallback mechanisms when remote servers are unavailable, transitioning to local mode operation. Document the server-side control server implementation with party registration, peer management, and state synchronization. Include connection pooling, error handling, and network resilience features. Address security considerations for client authentication and message encryption. Provide deployment guidelines for control server infrastructure and scaling considerations.

wiki_catalogs.name: Security and Encryption
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop comprehensive content for LANrage's security implementation using WireGuard's cryptographic primitives. Document the ChaCha20-Poly1305 authenticated encryption providing confidentiality and integrity protection for all gaming traffic. Explain the X25519 key exchange mechanism ensuring forward secrecy and perfect forward security properties. Detail the peer-to-peer trust model eliminating the need for certificate authorities or central PKI infrastructure. Document the cryptographic key management including private/public key generation, base64 encoding for configuration, and secure storage practices. Explain the ephemeral key rotation strategies, session key derivation, and protection against replay attacks. Include the security implications of the mesh topology, peer verification mechanisms, and protection against man-in-the-middle attacks in distributed gaming scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Error Handling Strategies
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for LANrage's error handling strategies and fault tolerance mechanisms. Document the exception propagation patterns from low-level network operations to high-level API responses. Explain the graceful degradation strategies when components fail or become unavailable. Detail the retry mechanisms, circuit breaker patterns, and fallback procedures for critical operations. Document the error logging strategies, debugging information capture, and diagnostic data collection. Include the user-facing error messages, recovery procedures, and system state restoration after failures. Address the monitoring and alerting mechanisms for component health and performance degradation.

wiki_catalogs.name: Control Plane Implementation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive documentation for LANrage's control plane implementation architecture. Document the abstract ControlPlane base class and its concrete implementations including LocalControlPlane and RemoteControlPlane. Explain the factory pattern used for control plane instantiation and configuration. Detail the transition from local SQLite-based control plane to WebSocket-based remote control plane. Cover the control plane client-server communication protocols, message handling, and state synchronization. Document the fallback mechanisms when remote control plane is unavailable. Include practical examples of control plane configuration, client initialization, and server integration. Address the architectural evolution roadmap and migration strategies between local and remote control plane modes.

wiki_catalogs.name: Session Persistence & State Management
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for session persistence and state management in party coordination. Document the Party data model persistence, including party metadata, peer lists, and connection state storage. Explain the integration with the database-first configuration system for persistent party state. Detail session recovery mechanisms, automatic party restoration after restarts, and state synchronization across application instances. Cover party state validation, corruption detection, and recovery procedures. Document the relationship between party state and network configuration persistence. Include backup and restore procedures for party configurations, state migration strategies, and compatibility with configuration changes. Provide examples of state management operations and recovery scenarios.

wiki_catalogs.name: Environment Integration & Overrides
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for LANrage's environment integration and configuration override system focused on external configuration sources and dynamic environment handling. Document the environment variable processing system including override precedence, type conversion, and validation integration. Explain the integration with external configuration systems, command-line arguments, and runtime parameter injection. Detail the configuration override mechanisms including temporary overrides, conditional settings, and environment-specific configurations. Document the security considerations for environment-based configuration including sensitive data handling and exposure prevention. Include examples of environment-specific deployments, container configurations, and cloud platform integration. Address the relationship between database-first configuration and external environment sources, including synchronization and conflict resolution. Provide guidance on implementing custom environment integration points and extending the override system.

wiki_catalogs.name: Network Operations and Monitoring
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for network operations and monitoring capabilities focused on interface status tracking, peer connectivity assessment, and performance measurement. Document the get_interface_status() method for retrieving WireGuard interface information via wg show commands, latency measurement through ping operations with platform-specific implementations, and logging mechanisms for network operations. Explain the asynchronous logging system using aiofiles for network.log file management, error handling strategies for command failures, and timeout management for network operations. Detail the peer management operations including add_peer() with endpoint configuration and persistent keepalive settings, remove_peer() operations, and wg command execution patterns. Include monitoring strategies, performance optimization tips, and troubleshooting approaches for network connectivity issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Relay Fallback Mechanism
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the relay fallback system and TURN server integration. Document the relay discovery hierarchy including control plane discovery, configured relay fallback, and default relay server usage. Explain the relay endpoint selection process with latency measurement, geographic proximity considerations, and performance optimization. Detail the relay server architecture, packet forwarding mechanisms, and load balancing strategies. Document the integration with the control plane for dynamic relay discovery, the fallback chain from control plane to configured to default relays, and error handling for relay unavailability. Include the relay endpoint format, connection establishment procedures, and quality metrics collection. Address the trade-offs between direct P2P connections and relay usage, bandwidth considerations, and latency implications. Provide troubleshooting guidance for relay connection failures, server health monitoring, and automatic failover mechanisms.

wiki_catalogs.name: Optimization Application
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for the game optimization application system covering how detected games trigger network optimizations. Document the GameOptimizer class functionality including adaptive keepalive calculation based on NAT type, QoS packet prioritization, and MTU optimization. Explain the integration with NAT traversal strategies, the relationship between game profiles and network configuration, and the automatic application of game-specific settings. Detail the optimization parameters including low_latency, high_bandwidth, packet_priority settings, and their impact on network performance. Include the NAT type detection influence on keepalive intervals, the adaptive optimization algorithms, and the rollback mechanisms when games stop. Provide examples of optimization scenarios, performance improvements achieved, and troubleshooting optimization conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Setup and Configuration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for Discord integration setup and configuration focused on initial installation, credential management, and environment configuration. Document the step-by-step setup process for each integration type including webhook creation, bot application setup, and Rich Presence configuration. Explain the credential management system including webhook URLs, bot tokens, invite links, and application IDs stored in the database-first configuration. Detail the configuration validation process including URL format checking, token verification, and connectivity testing. Document the quick setup helper function for rapid deployment scenarios. Include practical examples of configuration files, environment variables, and runtime configuration updates. Address security considerations for token management, URL validation, and access control. Provide comprehensive troubleshooting guidance for common setup issues including permission errors, invalid credentials, and connectivity problems.

wiki_catalogs.name: API Reference
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for LANrage's REST API and web interface endpoints. Document all HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and authentication requirements for party management, configuration, metrics, and Discord integration endpoints. Include WebSocket connection handling for real-time updates and status monitoring. Document the web UI API endpoints for dashboard, settings, and server browser functionality. Provide comprehensive request/response examples with JSON schemas and error codes. Include authentication mechanisms, rate limiting, and security considerations. Document common use cases, client implementation guidelines, and integration patterns. Address API versioning, backwards compatibility, and deprecation policies. Include practical examples for common integration scenarios and troubleshooting guidance for API issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Deployment Topology
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's deployment architecture and infrastructure topology. Document the client deployment model including standalone executables, auto-updates, and local web UI serving. Explain the relay node deployment options including Docker containers, systemd services, and minimal dependency requirements. Detail the scalability architecture from single relay deployments to geographic relay pools with anycast routing. Document the monitoring and observability setup including latency graphs, connection tracking, and bandwidth usage monitoring. Explain the deployment automation and CI/CD pipeline integration. Include infrastructure requirements, resource planning, and capacity planning guidelines. Address high availability strategies, disaster recovery procedures, and maintenance procedures. Document the future roadmap for deployment enhancements including IPv6 support and enhanced UI architecture.

wiki_catalogs.name: Game Detection & Profiles
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's game detection and optimization system focused on automatic game profiling, broadcast emulation, and custom game configurations. Document the game detection algorithms including file system scanning, process monitoring, and game-specific pattern recognition. Explain the game profile system including predefined profiles for 112+ games, custom profile creation, and profile-based optimization strategies. Detail the broadcast emulation functionality for legacy games requiring multicast/broadcast support, and the automatic configuration application based on detected games. Document the game profile JSON schema, parameter validation, and profile inheritance mechanisms. Include the integration with the party system for game-specific optimizations and the metrics collection for game performance monitoring. Provide implementation details for the game detection heuristics, profile matching algorithms, and configuration application processes. Address the extensibility mechanisms for adding new game profiles and troubleshooting detection issues.

wiki_catalogs.name: Settings & Configuration API
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create API documentation for LANrage's settings and configuration management endpoints. Document HTTP methods, URL patterns, request/response schemas, and validation requirements for settings retrieval, updates, and configuration management. Include detailed examples for SettingsRequest model with all configurable parameters and SaveConfigRequest for configuration templates. Document settings validation, default values, and configuration activation/deactivation. Provide practical examples for automated configuration management and settings synchronization.

wiki_catalogs.name: Broadcast and Multicast Emulation
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Develop detailed content for the broadcast and multicast emulation system designed to support legacy games that rely on network discovery protocols. Document the broadcast port monitoring system, custom port whitelist functionality, and how the system emulates broadcast/multicast traffic over the mesh VPN. Explain the dynamic port monitoring mechanism, custom broadcast port configuration through custom_broadcast_ports.json, and integration with the game detection system. Detail the packet forwarding logic, port filtering, and traffic optimization for broadcast-heavy games. Include examples of configuring custom broadcast ports for games not included in standard profiles, troubleshooting broadcast detection issues, and performance considerations for broadcast traffic. Document the relationship between broadcast emulation and game-specific optimizations, including how the system adapts to different game networking requirements.

wiki_catalogs.name: Game Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's game integration system focused on automatic game detection and optimization. Explain the game profile system using JSON configurations for game-specific settings including broadcast emulation, QoS parameters, and connection preferences. Detail the 112+ supported games organized by genre categories including strategy, survival, FPS, racing, and competitive games. Document the custom game profile creation process for unsupported games. Include configuration examples, parameter explanations, and optimization strategies for different game types. Address legacy game support through broadcast emulation and multicast simulation. Provide troubleshooting guidance for game detection issues and profile conflicts.

wiki_catalogs.name: Discord Integration
wiki_catalogs.prompt: Create comprehensive content for LANrage's Discord integration system focused on webhook notifications, Rich Presence implementation, and voice chat coordination. Document the Discord integration architecture including webhook configuration, message formatting, and event-driven notifications. Explain the Rich Presence implementation for game state display, party status updates, and player activity tracking. Detail the voice chat integration for party coordination, voice channel management, and audio quality optimization. Document the bot features including party management commands, user authentication, and administrative functions. Include the webhook payload structure, message templates, and notification scheduling.
